metadata.title: CVE-2021-3566 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Prior to ffmpeg version 4.3, the tty demuxer did not have a 'read_probe'function assigned to it. By crafting a legitimate "ffconcat" file thatreferences an image, followed by a file the triggers the tty demuxer, thecontents of the second file will be copied into the output file verbatim(as long as the `-vcodec copy` option is passed to ffmpeg).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra60 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec60 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavdevice60 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter-extra9 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter9 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat-extra60 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat60 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavutil58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libpostproc57 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libswresample4 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libswscale7 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2').
